items.title: Nancey Murphy - A New Heaven & A New Earth?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
<article>Shop Closer To Truth merch like mugs, hoodies, and T-shirts to show your support of the show: https://bit.ly/3P2ogje

‘A new heaven and a new earth’ is the grand vision of the Bible. The Judeo-Christian scriptures tell of a future time when all things shall be made new. What could this mean? Does ‘all’ include the entire cosmos? Multiple universes, if there are such? Could such an ancient vision ever make sense? Believers say, “It’s God’s mystery.” They should say more.

items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
<article>Follow us on Instagram for daily news, announcements, and exciting updates: https://shorturl.at/p2IhM

Panpsychism is the extreme claim that everything in the physical world—all subatomic particles-are in some sense ‘conscious’ or have a basic kind of ‘proto-consciousness’. Why are an increasing number of leading philosophers taking panpsychism seriously? Something must be up. Could it be doubt that the scientific project to explain consciousness has failed?

items.title: Alvin Plantinga - If God Knows the Future, What is Free Will?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
<article>Subscribe to the Closer To Truth podcast on Apple, Spotify, or wherever you get your podcasts. Listen today: https://shorturl.at/mtJP4

For God to be God, God must be infallible and know the future perfectly, including all my actions from birth to death. For my will to be free, my actions must not be constrained. But if God knows the future—if God literally knows now what I am going to do later – then how are my actions later not constrained? How then free will?

items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
<article>Subscribe to the Closer To Truth podcast on Apple, Spotify, or wherever you listen: https://shorturl.at/mtJP4

If God is perfect, does this mean that God cannot change? Since perfection cannot be improved, would any change diminish God’s perfection? But a changeless God has problems, such as relating to humans in sequence and not progressing. God is more complex than we can imagine, but trying to relate God’s changelessness to God’s perfection probes God’s essence.

items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
